raw: The US Federal Reserve slashed its interest rate target by one percentage point to near zero ( a lower limit of 0 % and an upper limit of .25 % ) on Sunday in an emergency response to the coronavirus pandemic , The Wall Street Journal reports .

raw: The emergency rate cut was the Fed 's second in two weeks , after it reduced its guidance by half a percentage point on March 3 .
replaced: The Fed rate change was Fed second in two weeks , after Fed reduced Fed guidance by half a percentage point on March 3 .

raw: "The changing Fed rate is likely to yield a benefit to consumers on loan and credit products .
replaced: "The changing Fed rate is likely to yield a benefit to consumers on loan and credit products .

raw: Because the Fed rate affects the cost of borrowing , changes can ripple through to consumer - facing products .
replaced: Because the Fed rate  Fed rate affects the cost of borrowing , changes can ripple through to consumer - facing products .

raw: For example , after the Fed 's first emergency rate cut , mortgage rates hit their lowest level on record : The average rate on a 30 - year fixed - rate mortgage was 3.36 % for the week of March 12 , and the average rate for a 15 - year fixed - rate mortgage was 2.77 % , per data from Freddie Mac cited by the Journal .

raw: In a similar vein , a decline in federal interest rates can also affect the APR on credit cards , which are decided based on a broad market rate plus a margin decided by each card company ( which averaged 12.13 percentage points as of November 2019 , per an analysis of Fed data by WalletHub.com cited by the Journal ) .

raw: The Fed rate change could affect the broader market rate , leading to lower APRs , provided card lenders do n't choose to hike their margins .
replaced: The Fed rate change  Fed rate change could affect the broader market rate , leading to lower APRs , provided card lenders do n't choose to hike card lenders margins .

raw: But a near - zero rate is likely to cause negative effects for banks when it comes to savings products , especially challenger banks that offer high - yield savings accounts .
replaced: But a near - zero rate is likely to cause negative effects for banks when it comes to savings products , especially challenger banks that offer high - yield savings accounts .

raw: A slipping Fed rate will encourage more loan activity from banks and discourage them from offering high interest rates on savings accounts for the sake of profit margins .
replaced: A slipping Fed rate will This more loan activity from banks and discourage banks from offering high interest rates on savings accounts for the sake of profit margins .

raw: This will likely put the most pressure on banks that use high - yield savings accounts to generate new business to lower their rates .
replaced: This will likely put the most pressure on banks that use high - yield savings accounts to generate new business to lower banks that use high - yield savings accounts rates .

raw: We've seen similar occurrences before : Ahead of anticipated cuts last August , Goldman Sachs ' Marcus digital bank reduced its interest rate from 2.25 % to 2.15 % , and its rate has since slid even further , to 1.7 % .
replaced: We've seen similar occurrences before : Ahead of anticipated cuts last August , Marcus reduced Marcus interest rate from 2.25 % to 2.15 % , and Marcus rate has since slid even further , to 1.7 % .

raw: The more that banks like Marcus have to reduce their rates , the less they 'll be able to stand out from competitors and lure in customers with the promise of better return on their savings than they would see with incumbents .
